perturbation.original_text: Each Party agrees that it shall make available to the other Party the services of its employees and contractors reasonably necessary to assist the other Party with the prosecution of, and other patent or trademark office proceedings (e.g., reissue, reexamination, interference, inter partes review, post-grant review, supplemental examination, and other similar proceedings) regarding the other Party's Patents, Trademarks and other Intellectual Property (collectively, "IP Proceedings"). Each Party agrees to reasonably make available to the other Party (i) inventors and other reasonably necessary persons employed by it for the other Party's reasonable needs regarding execution of documents, interviews, declarations and testimony, and (ii) documents, materials and information for the other Party's reasonable good faith needs regarding such IP Proceedings.
perturbation.changed_text: Each Party will attempt to make available to the other Party the services of its employees and contractors to assist the other Party with the prosecution of IP Proceedings. Each Party will endeavor to make available to the other Party (i) inventors and other persons employed by it for the other Party's needs regarding execution of documents, interviews, declarations and testimony, and (ii) documents, materials and information for the other Party's needs regarding such IP Proceedings.
perturbation.explanation: The modification replaces 'shall make available' with 'will attempt to make available' and 'will endeavor to make available,' which introduces ambiguity and weakens the obligation. The original text clearly states the parties must make resources accessible, while the modified version allows them to potentially not fulfill the obligation. The phrase 'reasonably necessary' and 'reasonable good faith needs' has been removed which adds more ambiguity to the context.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of Contract - Introduces uncertainty that can prevent specific performance.

perturbation.original_text: Each Party will use reasonable efforts to maintain confidentiality of any trade secret or proprietary information contained within the Shared Library Materials in a manner materially consistent with the how the applicable Party protects its own trade secret or proprietary information.
perturbation.changed_text: Each Party will use efforts to maintain confidentiality of any trade secret or proprietary information contained within the Shared Library Materials.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'reasonable' and the standard for how the party protects their own information, the contract becomes ambiguous regarding how much effort must be applied to maintaining confidentiality. The original clause defined what was 'reasonable' by referencing internal practices, making the obligations more concrete. This change makes it difficult to determine if a breach has occurred because there is no standard by which to measure the party's efforts.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Trade Secret Law - State laws regarding trade secret protection often require reasonable measures to maintain secrecy. This change introduces ambiguity and the effort is not clearly defined.

perturbation.original_text: RemainCo and SpinCo shall hold and shall cause the members of the RemainCo Group and the SpinCo Group, respectively, to hold, and shall each cause their respective officers, employees, agents, consultants and advisors to hold, in strict confidence and not to disclose or release without the prior written consent of the other Party, any and all Confidential Information (as defined herein) of such other Party or the members of its Group; provided, that the Parties may disclose, or may permit disclosure of, such Confidential Information (i) to their respective auditors, attorneys, financial advisors, bankers and other appropriate consultants and advisors who have a need to know such information and are informed of their obligation to hold such information confidential to the same extent as is applicable to the Parties and in respect of whose failure to comply with such obligations, RemainCo or SpinCo, as the case may be, will be responsible or (ii) to the extent any member of the RemainCo Group or the SpinCo Group is compelled to disclose any such Confidential Information by judicial or administrative process or, in the opinion of legal counsel, by other requirements of Law.
perturbation.changed_text: RemainCo and SpinCo will try to hold the members of their groups, officers, employees, agents, consultants and advisors in confidence and not to disclose or release without the prior written consent of the other Party, Confidential Information; provided, that the Parties can disclose Confidential Information (i) to auditors, attorneys, financial advisors, bankers and consultants and advisors who are informed of their obligation to hold such information confidential or (ii) to the extent any member is compelled to disclose by judicial process or legal requirements.
perturbation.explanation: The original text uses the word 'shall' which creates a strict obligation for both parties. By changing 'shall hold' to 'will try to hold', and removing the phrase 'in strict confidence,' the legal obligation is weakened and introduces ambiguity in the extent to which the confidentiality must be maintained. The removal of 'appropriate' before consultants and advisors weakens the restriction of who the information is shared with. The modification removes the clause placing responsibility on the parties for the failure of their representatives to maintain confidentiality.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of Contract - The ambiguity created surrounding the level of effort can make it more difficult to prove a breach of confidentiality.
